summary.p: The Constant Scan operator introduces zero or one row into a query. A Compute Scalar operator is often used to add columns to a row produced by a Constant Scan operator.
The Empty property indicates whether this operator will introduce a row. For example, an empty Constant Scan is produced for a query for which the WHERE clause is always FALSE.
Constant Scan is a logical and physical operator.

tr.td: Indicates whether this Constant Scan actually represents an empty table.
Specifies the set of values stored in the table.
